feed.title: NewsTracker: apple tv
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Apple TV box launch postponed: Report
entry.summary:
LOS ANGELES - Apple has postponed the launch of a new version of its Apple TV streaming box, and won't show off the new device at its WorldWide Developer Conference in San Francisco next Monday, according to a New York Times report.

The paper reports that Apple planned to launch the new device at WWDC until about mid-May, but changed course over the last couple of weeks because the hardware wasn't ready.

The next generation of Apple TV is supposed to come with an improved remote control, and give developers easier access to the box, possibly even extending the iTunes App Store to Apple TV itself.

entry.title: Apple shelved plans for TV set more than a year ago: Report [Video]
The new Apple TV may feature a redesigned remote with a touchpad
Apple likely to boost watch production quickly: analysts
entry.summary: (Reuters) - Apple Inc (AAPL.O) is likely to quickly ramp production of the Apple Watch after strong pre-orders outstripped limited supply in the first weekend following its launch, some Wall Street analysts said.

entry.title: With primetime TV, Apple hopes to hook customers for new Watch
entry.summary:
Nevertheless, Apple is out-spending other smartwatch makers like Samsung Electronics and has a history of getting a big return from its TV advertising spending.

"Apple occupies 13 percent of spending in the smartphone category, while generating 40 percent of the buzz garnered from TV ads", said Sean Muller, CEO of iSpot.tv.

entry.title: With primetime TV, Apple hopes to hook customers for new Watch
entry.summary: That's a little less than the $42 million Apple spent over the past five months on TV ads for the iPhone 6 and 6 Plus.

entry.title: HBO Now available ? now on Apple TV
Can you really save money by cutting the TV cord?
entry.summary: You'll need a smart TV with the right apps included or a streaming device such as Roku, Apple TV, Xbox or PlayStation.

entry.title: Apple reportedly on new quest to start online TV service
entry.summary: Last week, Apple dropped the price of the Apple TV from $99 to $69.

entry.title: Fin24.com | Apple in talks over TV service, report says
entry.summary: The approximately 25 channels would be available on all iOS operating system devices such as iPhones, iPads and Apple TV boxes.

entry.title: Apple Plans Web TV Service In Fall
Apple in talks to launch online TV service: Report
entry.summary:
Apple is in talks to launch an online TV service, the Wall Street Journal reported late Monday, citing sources familiar with the matter.

The tech giant is working with programmers to offer a bundled service of about 25 channels anchored by broadcasters like ABC, CBS and Fox, on devices such as Apple TV.

The service will not offer NBC broadcast network and cable channels such as USA and Bravo, after a fallout between Apple and Comcast, parent of NBC and CNBC, the report said.

Both firms were in talks last year to tie-up on a streaming TV platform.
